name: ZOLA 2.0
description: A simple rebuild of ZoLA using a modern stack.  Toggle supporting layers, click individual features for more info

name: Census Factfinder
description: A simple rebuild of Census Factfinder using a modern stack and a few new features

name: Population Growth JaneLayer
description: Time-based view of population data at various admin boundaries

name: Soft Site Analysis Tool
description: Adjust criteria for what defines a soft site, quickly see maps of soft sites in an area, print a soft site report.

name: PLUTO Explorer
description: Could be part of ZoLa, but functionality similar to plutopages.com, with a deep link URL to each BBL.  BBL pages can then link to Bisweb, capital planning platform, etc

name: Applicant Map Clipper
description: Allow applicants to define a project site and get “stock” land use and zoning maps, eliminate the need to build their own maps for an application (or have DCP staff re-do the work themselves)

name: Planning Knowledge Base
description: Allow anyone in the agency to append content, wiki style.  A place to store contacts, documents, etc related to a study or project, or anything really.  No coding skills required

name: CPC Actions Map
description: Complement the CPC actions list lookup with an interactive map and filtering by CD, boro, time range, etc.

name: CEQR App
description: Web tools that facilitate the analysis for some of the easier chapters- e.g. an online version of Neera’s Schools Model, something on DEP, etc.

name: Community Portal Top-Level Map
description: Replace the flash-based map on the neighborhood profiles page on our website.

name: 3D Model Clip and Ship
description: Import the massive 3D building model provided by DoITT, allow users to download small sections of the city, optimize/transform for use in Sketchup, other 3D modelling tools

name: Open Trip Planner Buildout
description: Add other modes (ferries, buses, cars) to our OTP server, write good docs and a public-facing API

name: DANGIT - Data Nudged Into GIT
description: Experimental open-source database version control.  Useful for PLUTO, facDB, and other datasets that change from time to time and need better version control.

name: Remote Data Collection Kiosks
description: Simple survey devices that allow people to tap a button, a microcomputer logs the responses.  Can be used for basic street-level surveys

name: Computer Vision Counting
description: Count people, bikes, vehicles, etc.  Tap into the Open Source computer vision world so that we can produce our own traffic count data

name: BBL List Generator
description: This use case came up in a recent meeting, but it is often necessary for planners to generate a list of BBLs for a study area.   This could be a simple web map that does nothing more than allow a user to draw a polygon or multiploygon, and then generates a CSV of all BBLs that intersect, which can be downloaded.

name: POPs Map and Reporting Tool
description: Finally, an official map and spatial dataset for POPs, including a feedback tool for citizens to report abuse, mismanagement, etc.

name: Building Activity in Rezoning Areas
description: Maps that aggregate building activity in various rezoning areas, perhaps including a page for each rezoning action with information about what has transpired since the rezoning occurred.
